Blog moderation vs. accessibility

I moderate my blog comments because s9y originally required CAPTCHA as a plug-in, and because I don't believe in using CAPTCHA to block spam (because the tradeoff is that the visually impaired get screwed over by CAPTCHA).

However, it seems that one of the recent point releases of s9y added CAPTCHA by default, so now, having been too lazy to disable CAPTCHA, I have a blog with both CAPTCHA and moderated comments. There's certainly no spam going through, at least...

Note that there's nothing to prevent an evil blog owner from deleting comments after they have been posted anyways; call it post-facto moderation rather than pre-emptive moderation.

Moderation

I have had my blog for just over 2 years, and I get at least 100 spams a day (on a slow day).

I don't believe in CAPTCHA's, but a black list which I've built over the last 2 years, and not allowing more than 4 links on a page catches 95% of the SPAM.

Why I'm saying this I don't know... but my elaborate system has eaten legit comments, and I can imagine having to moderate individual comments would be even more problematic.

If anyone wants a copy of my ever-evolving black list drop me an email.
